meanings.definition: The ability of different systems or components to exchange and make use of information.
meanings.sent1: The interoperability of the software allows it to communicate with various devices seamlessly.
meanings.sent2: The success of the project depended on the interoperability of the different departments working together.
meanings.sent3: The lack of interoperability between the two teams led to confusion and delays in the project.
meanings.sent4: The interoperability between the two organizations was like a well-oiled machine, smoothly sharing resources.
meanings.sent5: The interoperability of the new technology was so impressive that it revolutionized the industry.

meanings.definition: The capability of a product or system to work with other products or systems without special effort on the part of the customer.
meanings.sent1: The interoperability of the devices allowed users to easily connect them without any extra steps.
meanings.sent2: The smart home system's interoperability with various devices made it a popular choice among consumers.
meanings.sent3: The humorous aspect of the situation was that the lack of interoperability made the user manual unnecessary.
meanings.sent4: The interoperability of the new software was a bridge connecting different tools and simplifying tasks.
meanings.sent5: The seamless interoperability of the platform made it a user-friendly solution for businesses.
